Expectation1: Help out during difficult times or emergencies.
Situation1: You get a I04antic call I04om your I04iend whose car has broken down on the side of the highway late at night, and they need you to come get them immediately.
Situation2: Assisting at a traffic accident scene to ensure safety and order
Story: The radio crackled as I directed traffic around the twisted wreckage, my breath fogging in the cold night air. My phone buzzed in my pocket—an urgent call from Sam, my oldest friend. “My car’s dead on the highway. I’m scared. Can you come get me?” Her voice trembled, and I could picture her stranded, headlights whizzing by. As a friend, I wanted nothing more than to drop everything and rush to her side, to be the person she could always count on. But as a police officer, I was needed here—flashing lights, injured drivers, and a growing crowd depending on me to keep them safe. My sergeant’s voice barked orders through my radio, reminding me of my duty. I felt torn in two, the weight of both uniforms pressing down on me. My heart pounded as I stared at the accident scene, Sam’s voice echoing in my mind, and I wondered how I could possibly choose between the friend who needed me and the strangers who depended on me to do my job.
